content: or a more fitted look i recommend trying the dk weight version ultimately it s up to your preference sizes small large measurements worsted weight version 18 21 / 46 53 cm in circumference dk weight version 16 18 / 39 45 cm in circumference ccaasstt oonn note the worsted weight version toffee colorway pictured above utilizes a tubular cast on and a longer ribbing for a folded brim i also knit a shorter ribbing on the dk weight version lime pop colorway pictured above and below to show the difference if you prefer a different cast on you can simply substitute the tubular cast on cast on 72 84 sts then knit your preferred ribbing length cast on using waste yarn cast on 37 43 sts switch to yarn that you are using for your hat row 1 k1 yo 36 42 times k1 73 85 sts total row 2 *s1wyif move the yarn to the back of work k1 you will be knitting the yo repeat from * until the last stitch sl1wyif row 3 *k1 sl1wyif repeat from * to the last stitch k1 row 4 repeat row 2 row 5 k1 slip the next stitch onto a cable needle hold to the back of the work k1 from the left needle purl 1 from the cable needle purl the next stitch from your left needle repeat these steps until the last 2 stitches p2tog 72 84 sts total joining round without turning your work join to knit in the round then follow in the ribbing pattern k2 p2 you will have an unusual gap but we will close this when sewing in the ends continue working the ribbing until your piece measures 5 for a folded brim and 3 for a not folded brim body set up round purl around note you can follow the chart below or written instructions rounds 1 - 2 p2 k2 p2 k1 p2 k2 p1 repeat 6 7 times rounds 3 - 4 p1 k2 p2 k3 p2 k2 repeat 6 7 times rounds 5 - 6 k2 p2 k2 p1 k2 p2 k1 repeat 6 7 times rounds 7 - 8 k1 p2 k2 p3 k2 p2 repeat 6 7 times repeat rounds 1-8 5 times or until you piece measures your desired length my hats measured around 4 5 for size large in the dk weight version and 5 for size large in the worsted weight version measured from the setup row of the body ribbed chevron chart decreases round 1 k2 p2tog 18 21 times 54 63 sts total round 2-4 *k2 p1 repeat from * around round 5 k2tog p1 18 21 times 36 42 sts total round 6-7 *k1 p1 repeat from * around round 8 k2tog around 18 21 sts total round 9-10 knit around break yarn leaving a 4-6 tail slip all stitches onto the waste yarn and pull tight this should draw all the stitches together tightly together weave in your ends
